ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I improved my Chinese writing, reading, and comprehension skills and fluency.
Learned more chinese grammar, vocabulary, reading, and writing.

Learned hundreds of new characters, became more confident in vocabulary, speaking, listening, and writing in Chinese, and also learned about Chinese cultures and how to apply new language skills in understanding my heritage and immigration stories.
Chinese grammar, characters, short essay-writing skills, history, Chinese in America today.
Writing, reading, listening comprehension, grammar complexity, new vocabulary, better understanding and appreciation for my Chinese heritage
I learned how to read, write, and speak over 800 characters.
I learned several hundred new Chinese characters, additional forms of grammar + sentence structure, cultural insights, and much more.
Expansion of vocabulary from L1, and emphasis on grammatical structures.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course was well taught and I learned a lot.
I feel like there could be more interaction between students in less manufactured ways. Rather than always utilizing the specific grammar or vocabulary in the lesson.
Very good course that keeps you on track with the timeline and daily syllabus style. Learned lots of Chinese and was able to apply it through a diverse variety of projects.
Strengths: 4 days in class and one day asynchronous really helped make the work load more manageable, gave us time to review the week's lesson and catch up on any missed work

The teacher is very committed to her class and she makes learning very enjoyable.  The Chinese program also has a lot of fun activities and events that contribute to the learning. The weakness of the class is that it meets everyday, but I also think that it's necessary for a language class.

is an amazing instructor, which is absolutely the biggest strength of the course! I also really appreciated the 4-1 model of the course, where we were able to use Friday as a day to catch-up and individually practice without needing to go to class  I was very stressed about the workload of an intensive language course at the beginning, but the 4-1 model definitely helped tremendously in allowing me to learn at a comfortable pace.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Definitely if they are comfortable with speaking mandarin. Absolute fluency, writing, and reading skills were definitely not required.
Yes. It's a great place to learn Chinese. You really feel like you make a lot of progress and advancement.

Yes - for students who have a Chinese but aren't very confident or fluent in Chinese, I would definitely recommend this course. Chinese will come easier to students who already have a background in it, and this course went at the right pace to maximize heritage students' full potential. I really enjoyed the course and feel that I improved my language skills.
Yes! It's fantastic and the Chan Laoshi makes this course even better.

I would heavily recommend this course to heritage learners since the class is very well structured around compensating for a lot of the weaknesses of heritage learners.  The teacher is also excellent.

Absolutely!  is such an amazing professor, and this course is a great way to learn Chinese if you never had the chance to learn it formally. I had doubts about taking the course at first, but after a year with  and the Chinese program, I can say with certainty that you should definitely take this course.
Yes
